import plotly.express as ply
import plotly.graph_objects as go
from plotly.subplots import make_subplots
import numpy as np
import pandas as pd
source.ee0b955a:
ply.scatter(data_frame= gdp,
           x= "Year",
           y="Value",

source.1e272717:
fig = go.Figure(data=go.Scattergl(x = gdp["Year"],
                                  y = gdp["Value"],
                                  mode='markers',
    marker=dict(
        color=np.random.randn(256),
        colorscale='Viridis',
        line_width=1
    )
))

fig.show()
source.be925829: **MEAN has risen showing that the world is more prosperous now but STD has risen showing the growth in inequality has followed.**
